author: Special Correspondent
text:
A total of seven lakh people will be screened under the Non-Communicable Diseases screening camp across the Union Territory of Puducherry to check the incidence of non-communicable diseases including cancer and cardiac disorders.

Inaugurating a camp organised at the Community Health Centre at Tirunallar near here, T. Kalimuthu, Managing Director, Karaikal District Health Mission, said the camps were being held in a phased manner across the territory.

So far, the camps had been organised at the Community Health Centres in Karikalampakkam, Manndipet, Mettupalayam and Tirubuvanai.

Underlining the importance for early detection of cancer, he said creating awareness was more important among the needy persons for eliminating the disease. He said that the Health Department had taken up steps for early intervention in diabetes.

The focus was to ensure consumption of healthy and nutritious breakfast to prevent the incidence of Type 2 diabetes and avoid complications related to diabetes. A cardiac camp was held as part of the programme.

K. Santhimathi, Programme Officer, National Programme for Prevention and Control of Cancer, Diabetes, Cardiovascular Disease and Strokes (NPCDSC), K. Mohanraj, Chief Medical Officer and P. Narayanasamy, Deputy Director of Immunisation spoke.

Earlier, Dr. Kalimuthu released booklet on the ‘Healthy Life’ to the medical officers.
title: Medical camps
